Marlene, de 64 años, es una mujer muy buena y amable, está casada con Jorge y fruto de su matrimonio tiene 6 hijos que ya son mayores e independientes, vive en su casa propia junto a 5 hijos de los cuales brinda mayor atención a su última hija de 15 años, ya que los demás generan sus propios ingresos. 
El trabajo de Marlene, consiste en la venta de comida, instala sus mesas y sillas en la vereda de su casa en donde ofrece a la venta gran variedad de potajes regionales como “cecina con tacacho”, “juane”, “pescado ahumado”, chorizos y otros. Lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 2 años y trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos quienes le brindan el apoyo necesario para que todo siempre le vaya bien. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues esta en contacto con las personas, se divierte, se relaja y sobre todo genera ingresos económicos para su hogar, de esta forma puede darle lo necesario a su menor hija, algunas veces lleva pedidos a domicilio y siempre tiene clientes que le solicitan sus deliciosos potajes, le esta yendo bien y espera mas adelante poder poner un restaurante ya que tiene muchas expectativas en su negocio. Por ello solicita 3500 soles, para comprar ingredientes e insumos como arroz, carnes, condimentos, aceite, y verduras para seguir con la preparación de sus deliciosos platillos, además comprará ollas y otros utensilios que necesitan renovación.
texts.en:
Marlene, age 64, is a good-natured and kind woman. She is married to Jorge and they have six children who are grown and independent. Marlene lives in her own home with five of her children, but most of her attention is focused on her youngest daughter (age 15) since the others earn their own income.

Marlene’s work consists of selling food. She has tables and chairs set up along the pavement in front of her house. Marlene offers a wide variety of regional dishes such as “cecina con tacacho” (plantain fritters with pork), “juanes” (chicken and rice steamed in banana leaves), smoked fish, chorizo sausage, and other items. She has been in business for two years and works with the support of her children, who help out when necessary so that everything is always running well. Marlene enjoys her work because she likes being in contact with other people. She also finds the work relaxing, but most of all it gives her a way to generate household income so that she can provide whatever her youngest daughter needs. Sometimes Marlene will make home deliveries, but her customers are always requesting her delicious dishes. She is doing well and hopes to open a restaurant later on since she has high expectations for her business.

Marlene is requesting a loan of 3,500 PEN so that she can buy ingredients and supplies such as rice, meats, condiments, oil, and vegetables in order to continue preparing her delicious dishes. In addition, she will buy pots and other utensils since her existing ones need to be replaced.

loans.use: to buy rice, meats, condiments, oil, vegetables, pots, and utensils.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Шариф житель района Яван. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Шариф как и многие жители района зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается у себя дома. Шариф в этой области имеет богатый опыт. Он берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Sharif lives in the Yavan region of Tajikistan. He is 53 years old, married, and has seven children. Like many Yavan residents, Sharif earns a living by raising cattle, which he does at his home. He has a wealth of experience in this activity. Sharif is taking this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and repair of her rental house for better service

loans.name: Githa

texts.en:
Githa is a mother of two who lives in a town near the city. 

She has been running a second-hand clothes stall for the past year and is requesting this loan to buy further stock for her stall, where she sells women's, men's and children's clothes and shoes. The stall has been successful so far as it is in a good location right next to a busy road, so many people pass by.  

Githa has found that the money she can generate through her clothes business is just enough to survive - as apart from her own two children she has two younger siblings to care for.  She hopes that by buying new stock and gradually expanding her business she will be able to make more income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta, 49, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, a construction worker, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Julieta maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Julieta hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams to have a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Javkhaa

texts.en:
Mr. Javkhaa is 35 years old and lives with his family in their new wooden house in Kherlen, the third largest city in Mongolia. Javkhaa works as a driver at a private mineral company. His wife works a kindergarten teacher. Javkhaa’s son is nine years old and studies at a local secondary school.

This summer, Javkhaa’s family built a house but the interior is not yet finished. So Javkhaa is requesting a loan of 1.000.000 MNT to complete work on the house, using energy-saving materials and installing a low-pressure furnace that releases fewer harmful chemicals into the atmosphere, in order to save the environment. By doing this, he can reduce the heat loss from his home and burn less coal, and his family will live in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to complete work on his house, using energy-saving materials and installing a low-pressure furnace that releases fewer harmful chemicals into the atmosphere

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.ru:
Насибахон занимается разведением мелко - рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Насибахон берет кредит для закупа телят, чтобы заняться скотоводством. 
Насибахон проживает в районе Яван. Ей 33 года. Она разведена. Живет с матерью и братом.
texts.en: Nasibakhon raises sheep and goats.  She has been in this line of work for three years.  She is asking for a loan to buy calves so she can raise cattle.  Nasibakhon lives in the Yavan region.  She is 33 years old, divorced and lives with her mother and brother.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of cement to resell

loans.name: Leanard

texts.en:
Leanard opened the general store two years ago. He is a 19-year-old man who is married to Luvuno, and they live in the town of Kaloleni with their 7-month-old son. He struggles hard to provide for them. 

With the income from this store, he has been able to improve the quality of life for his family, and for this reason he always seeks to improve it. Thanks to his attention to the business, he has been having good sales recently. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to purchase household products in order to increase the variety of products that he offers his clients, and thus increase his sales.

Leanard's dream is to be able to have a business with more supplies, and thus improve the income for his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase household products such as foodstuffs, detergents, and other instant products.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy, 41, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Agapito, her business partner, and a mother to her children. Along with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nancy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of  PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nancy hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gulandona

texts.ru: Гуландона проживает в районе Яван. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Муж Гуландоны находится на заработках за рубежом. Сама Гуландона портниха. Она в основном шьет матрасы и национальные платья с вышивками. Этим видом деятельности Гуландона занимается восемь лет. В этой области она имеет хороший опыт. Гуландона берет кредит для приобретения новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Gulandona lives in the Yavan region.  She is 44 years old and is married with two children.  Her husband is a migrant worker abroad.  Gulandona is a dressmaker.  She mainly sews mattresses and embroidered national dresses.  She has been in this line of work for eight years and had good experience in this sphere.  Gulandona is asking for a loan to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Buburoziya

texts.ru: Бубурозия проживает в районе Яван. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее 8 детей. Бубурозия вместе с детьми работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Также он занимается растениеводством. У нее при доме имеется небольшой участок земли, где она сеет пшеницу, чтобы обеспечить семью мукой, а также вывести на рынок. Этим видом деятельности Бубурозия занимается четыре года. Она берет кредит для посева осеней пшеницы и овощей.
texts.en: Buburoziya lives in the Yavan region.  She is 48 years old and is married with eight children.  She tends an orchard with her children and works in agriculture.  She has a small plot of land next to her home where she sows wheat to provide her family with flour, as well as to sell at the market.  Buburoziya has been in this line of work for four years.  She is asking for a loan to plant wheat and vegetables this autumn.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fuel and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Amonullo

texts.ru:
Амонулло житель Яванского района. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Амонулло живет с родителями. Его жена домохозяйка. Отец Амонулло работает директором школы. Его брат находится на заработках за рубежом. 
Амонулло занимается скотоводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается восемь лет. Амонулло берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Amonullo lives in the Yavan region.  He is 28 years old and is married with one child.  He lives with his parents and his wife is a homemaker.  His father works as the director of a school and his brother is a migrant worker abroad.  Amonullo is a cattle breeder.  He raises large cattle for future sale and he has been in this line of work for eight years.  He is asking for a loan to buy bulls.

loans.use: to buy bulls.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru:
Мохира жительница Яванского района. Она замужем. Ей 23 года. Мохира имеет высшее педагогическое образование, она филолог. Мохира вот уже год как преподает предмет русский язык в школе. Кроме того она занимается растениеводством. Мохира при доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где она выращивает овощи. 
Мохира берет кредит для посева овощей.
texts.en: Mohira lives in the Yavan region.  She is 23 years old and is married.  She has a higher education and is a linguist.  Mohira has been teaching Russian language in a school for a year now, and she also works in agricutlure.  She has a small plot of land by her home where she grows vegetables.  She is asking for a loan to plant vegetables.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 34 year old married woman with three children who describes herself as a hard worker. She has been operating a retail store, where she sells cereals such as maize and beans, for four years. Her business is in an agricultural area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as weather changes that lead to cereal shortages. 

Hellen will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy three bags of maize and two bags of beans to sell. Her business goal is to be a supplier of cereals within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with profits generated from the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy three bags of maize and two bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta, 39, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Alimoderene, a driver and father to her children. She manages her household while operating a business. Now, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.  

Julieta operates a shop. She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells it for a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted by the low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy jackets, shirts for men and women, shorts, sandals and other ready-to-wear products needed to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Julieta hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zeby

texts.ru: Зеби 47 лет, замужем, воспитывает трех детей.В 2011 году кроме животноводства и растениеводства  семья Зеби начала заниматься торговлей продуктами питания. Стартовав с начальной суммы в 60,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день, ее магазин приносит около 20,000 сом в месяц. Доходы от бизнес – деятельности Зеби намерена вкладывать в развитие семьи и улучшение жилищных условий. Как она объяснила в магазине у нее мало товаров, для того чтобы увеличить продажи и получить больше прибыли ей необходимо увеличить ассортимент. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса и увеличения ассортимента, Зеби обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» второй раз за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товаров в магазин, для последующей реализации.
texts.en: Zeby is 47 years and is married with three children.  In 2011, in addition to livestock and agriculture, Zeby's family started to sell food products.  Starting with the sum of 60,000 som (KGS), the store brings in about 20,000 som per month now.  The income from this increased business will allow Zeby to look after her family and improve their living conditions.  She has explained that she has a small assortment of goods in her store and she needs to increase her offerings so her sales can improve.  With the goal of increasing her business, Zeby has turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for the second time for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy goods for resale in her store.

loans.use: to purchase goods for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as flour, eggs and sugar for making breads and pastries.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is a 32-year-old woman who is single with no children. She sells clothes, bags and shoes. She has been in this business for two years and she earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

This will be Marion's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase bags, shoes and clothes to sell during the high Christmas season. 

Marion plans to use the profits to open a big beauty shop. In the future, she wants to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stock of new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Aiymbubu

texts.ru: Айымбубу 58 лет, вдова. После смерти мужа Айымбубу осталась с сыном. Сын является надежной опорой для матери. У них имеется небольшой магазин в селе, где они занимаются продажей продуктов питания. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, Айымбубу занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство на сегодня приносит от 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На данный момент в хозяйстве Айымбубу имеется шесть дойных коров и 15 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айымбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. После откорма она сможет реализовать их на местном рынке. Доходы Айымбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и она мечтает купить квартиру в городе Каракол.
texts.en: Aiymbubu is 58 years old and a widow.  After her husband died, Aiymbubu was left with her son, who is a reliable support for his mother.  They have a small store in their village where they sell food products.  As the main source of income for her family, Aiymbubu also raises animals and manages the farm.  Beginning with the sum of 5,000 som (KGS), their household now brings in 8,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products.  Aiymbubu's farm currently has six dairy cows and 15 goats.  With the goal of increasing her business, Aiymbubu turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 55,000 som (KGS) to buy two bulls.  After fattening them up, she can resell them at the local market.  With this income, Aiymbubu plans on investing in further increasing her head of livestock and she dreams of buying an apartment in the city of Karakol.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
This is Jonathan, 22, a resident of Cabrera, Philippines. He is married to Mary Jean, an employee and mother to his child. Together with his wife, he manages their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Jonathan operates a business. He buys merchandise from wholesalers and sells it at a profit. His products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to his low prices and the many options he offers. He also has a variety store for additional income. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue to operate his business, he is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. He will use the loan to buy additional products and merchandise like shorts, shirts, pants, and blouses. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Jonathan hopes to be able to expand his business and dreams of sending his siblings to school. Every week,he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of clothes for his business.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб житель города Чкаловск. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Сухроб работает таксистом. В этой области он десять лет. Сухроб намерен приобрести новую машину. Для этого ему необходимо продать имеющую автомашину и взять кредит.
texts.en: Suhrob lives in Chkalovsk.  He's thirty-seven, married, and has one small child.  He's been a taxi driver for ten years.  He plans to buy a new car, so he needs to sell the one he has and get a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Crispin

texts.en:
Crispin is a 44-year-old married man. He has five children. He describes himself as a profit-oriented man. 

Crispin operates a retail store where he sells household items such as sugar, salt, maize flour, tea leaves, detergents, plastic items, cooking fat, etc. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a highly populated area and his primary customers are schools, residents and tourists. He describes his biggest business challenge as a shortage of stock to sell to the increasingly high demands of his customers. 

Crispin will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy household items to sell. His business goal is to run another retail shop within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have expanded and succeeded in his business. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM after taking a previous loan of KES 50,000, which he managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 34 years old and married. He and his wife are blessed with two children whom he supports. He has been running a motorcycle transport business for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Gabriel has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase another motorcycle for his transport business.

The anticipated profits will be invested back into his business for expansion as well as used to start a grocery store for his wife. His future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy petrol, cigarettes, more snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sasine

texts.en:
Sasine is 32 years old, married to Nori and blessed with three children that he supports. He has been a tomato farmer in the Olopito area for the last eight years, earning a monthly income of KES. 12,000.

With his fifth loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD, Sasine intends to acquire farm inputs for better yields. He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His dream is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, a 35-year-old mother of one, is married to George and sells new clothes, bags and shoes in Nairobi. In business for two years, she earns a monthly income of about 20,000 shillings.

This will be Rosemary's first loan from KADET LTD, with which she plans to purchase bags, shoes and clothes. She intends to use the profits to open a big beauty shop and improve her business. In future she wants to open a new clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy new clothes, hand bags, and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kenjebu

texts.ru: Кенжебу 53 года, замужем. Кенжебу воспитала 5 детей, младшая дочка является студенткой, остальные дети уже взрослые и работают сами. Муж активно помогает по хозяйству. Кенжебу имеет средне специальное образование, по характеру она очень спокойная и позитивная женщина. Она всегда верит в светлое будущее своей семьи, но никогда  не забывает суровые реалии. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, Кенжебу занимается животноводством и полеводством. По мимо этого в течении многих лет Кенжебу изготавливает и продает национальные без алкогольные напитки. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS)после развала СССР, сегодня хозяйство  приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На данный момент в хозяйстве Кенжебу имеется 2 дойных коров, 1 кобыла, 15 овец 10 кур одна очень красивая юрта. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кенжебу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3  молочных коров.Коровы будут приносить больше молока, тем самым она сможет увеличить объёмы производства национальных напитков.
texts.en:
Kenjebu is 53 years old and married. She has raised 5 children, the youngest of whom is a student, while the rest are adults and earn their own living. Kenjebu's husband actively helps her around the house. Kenjebu has vocational post-secondary education. She is a very calm and positive woman, who always believes in the bright future for her family, but never forgets the harsh realities of life.

As the main source of income for her family, Kenjebu raises livestock and cultivates crops. Additionally, for many years she has been preparing and selling traditional non-alcoholic beverages. Her business, launched with an initial investment of 15,000 som (KGS) after the break-up of the USSR, presently earns roughly 15,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. Currently, Kenjebu's farm includes 2 dairy cows, 1 mare, 15 sheep, 10 chickens, and one beautiful yurt.

In order to continue developing her business, Kenjebu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) to purchase 3 dairy cows. The cows will produce additional milk, and so Kenjebu will be able to prepare a larger volume of traditional beverages.

loans.use: to purchase 3 dairy cows

loans.name: Akpar

texts.ru: Акпар проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Акпар вместе со всей семьей занимается скотоводством. У него созданы условия для разведения крупнорогатого скота. Акпар разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности он занимается десять лет. Акпар берет кредит для закупа бычков с целью увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Akpar lives in the city of Khujand.  He's thirty-four and married with two children.  He and his family are in livestock farming, and he has built facilities for cattle breeding.  He's been raising cattle at home for ten years and is seeking a loan to buy calves to increase his herd.

loans.use: to buy calves to increase his herd.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señorita Patricia vive en casa de sus padres, ocupa una habitación, trabaja como odontóloga en un consultorio de su casa, la casa está ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la Ciudad de la Paz.

Patricia trabaja en su consultorio de odontología por más de ocho horas al día ya que es su única fuente de ingreso económico y además ayuda a pagar los gastos de servicios básicos a sus padres.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar herramientas de trabajo (nuevo taladro y pinzas y filtros) para su consultorio ya que los anteriores se encuentran un poco deteriorados.

El sueño de patricia es hacer crecer su consultorio, mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida.

Es la segunda vez con IMPRO  y la segunda vez que solicita que el crédito sea canalizado a través de KIVA, y está muy satisfecha con el crédito que le otorgamos porque le ayudará mucho.
texts.en:
Patricia lives in one room of her parents’ house.  She works as a dentist in an office at her house.  The house is in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.

Patricia works in her dental office for over eight hours a day because this is her only source of income.  She also helps pay her parents’ expenses for basic services.

She needs the loan to buy work tools (new drill, dental forceps, and filters) for her office.  The ones she has are a little damaged.  Patricia’s dream is to make her office grow, to improve her income, and to improve her quality of life.

This is her second time with IMPRO and the second time she has requested a loan to be channeled through Kiva.  She is very happy with the loan that we are giving her because it will help a lot.

loans.use: to buy a new drill, dental forceps, and filters for her office.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kintintale in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past 5 years, Richard has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells maize, cassava and millet flour. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 2000000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase his business and buy more flour to sell. This will help Richard to generate greater profits and enhance his business. Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to sell more produce and make higher profits. 

Richard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Richard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, millet and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for his electronics store.

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es:
María Verónica tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene dos hijos, vive, la esposo y con los hijos  en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.

María  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El sueño e s poder comprar casa para vivir con la familia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta enseñar a los hijos las tareas de la escuela.
texts.en:
María Verónica, age 32, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

The El Guasmo communal bank is located in the Aqua Fría de Mocache precinct in the Mocache canton.  They devote themselves to farming and livestock.

María grows corn.  She is requesting the loan to buy insecticides, urea, and herbicides.  With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs for the crops.  She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to be able to buy a house to live in with her family.  The challenges she faces are the pest infestations of her crops.

In her free time she likes to teach her children their homework.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, urea, and herbicides.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kintintale in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He has 2 children, 1 of whom is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential items. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2000000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. He will use this loan to buy more essential commodities such as sugar, rice and soap for resale. This will help Godfrey generate greater profits though increased sales. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to to boost his business. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and soap for resale,

loans.name: Ranohon

texts.ru: Ранохон 43 года, замужем. Ранохон воспитала 3 детей, сын взрослый работает в РФ на стройке, зарабатывает 10,000 KGS в месяц. Средняя дочка является инвалидкой 2 группы и получает пособие в размере 3,800 KGS  в месяц. младшая дочка учится в школе. Муж активно помогает по хозяйству. Ранохон имеет средне образование, по характеру очень трудолюбивая, честная и ответственная женщина. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, Ранохон занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) 25 лет назад, сегодня хозяйство приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На данный момент в хозяйстве Ранохон имеется 1 корова с теленком. В собственности заемщицы имеется 0,52 га земли и арендуемой землю площадью 1 га где они выращивают картофель, кукурузу, и хлопчатник. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ранохон обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 теленка. В будущие коровы будут приносить больше молока, тем самым она сможет увеличить свои доходы.
texts.en:
Ranohon is forty-three, married, and has raised three children.  Her son is grown and works in construction in the Russian Federation, earning 10,000KGS per month.  Her middle daughter is a paraplegic and receives a monthly stipend of 3,800KGS.  The youngest daughter is in school.  Her husband is very active in helping out on the farm.  Ranohon has a middle school education and is a very industrious, honest, and responsible person.  As the family's main breadwinner, she farms crops and breeds livestock.  She started out twenty-five years ago with 5,000KGS and today the farm brings in nearly 8,000KGS per month selling milk and milk products.

Ranohon currently has one cow with a calf.  The farm consists of .52 hectares of land and she rents a one hectare plot where they raise potatoes, corn, and cotton.  In order to expand her business, Ranohon has turned to Bai Tulum for a loan of 50,000KGS so she can buy two calves.  Down the line they will produce more milk and Ranohon can increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase 2 calves.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en: Eliud is a 35-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 10 years. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a truck that he uses to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located within an urban area and his primary customers are supermarkets and butcher shops. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of fuel. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy spare parts for his truck. His business goal is to start a new retail shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his family's living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He previously borrowed a loan of 20,000 KES, which he managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his truck.

loans.name: Widjiati

texts.en:
Widjiati is 44, married with 4 children.  All the children except one are attending school. 

Widjiati owns a reparation business (computers and printers); she has been running this business for 5 years. Widjiati realized that day by day, the business income is decreasing, as she needs to fulfill her family's needs.  She decided to start up a laundry business; she believes that she can increase her income. 

To implement her dream, Widjiati went to TLM and asked for a loan of IDR 3,000,000 for a washing machine. She plans to save the remaining funds for her children’s future needs.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to start a laundry business.

loans.name: Dianne Michelle

texts.en:
This is Dianne Michelle, 28, a resident of Cabrera, Philippines. She is married to Brian, a supervisor, and is the mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Dianne Michelle operates a laundry shop. She handles the operation and promotion. They offer washing of clothes and other garments, also folding and pressing. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy supplies like detergent, fabric softener and other materials they use in the business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Dianne Michelle dreams to be a successful businesswoman and hopes to get more customers in the market. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for detergent, fabric softener and other materials used in the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Matilde Amparo

texts.es:
Matilde Amparo tiene 24 años de edad de estado civil Soltera no tiene  hijos, vive,  con los padres  en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.

Matilde  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.

El sueño e s poder comprar un camión y una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta cocinar cosas ricas para la familia.
texts.en:
The El Guasmo community is located in the Agua Fria district of Mocache.  It’s part of the Mocache settlement where they farm and raise livestock.
 
Matilde farms and raises corn.  She is asking for a loan to buy insecticides, urea, and herbicides.  The loan will help her buy what she needs for her crops and she will make her purchases in Mocache.
 
Her dream is to be able to buy a truck and a house.  The challenges that she faces include blights to her crops.  She likes to cook delicious dishes in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: N’To

texts.fr:
N’TO est âgé de 45 ans et vit avec ses sept enfants et ses époux à DIENFING dans la sous-préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Région de KOULIKORO.
N’TO  n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le cinquième prêt il est à son sixième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 3 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de DIENFING et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
N’TO  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
N’TO is 45 years old and lives with his seven children and his wives in DIENFING in the sub-prefecture of OUELESSEBOUGOU, Region of KOULIKORO. N’TO did not have the chance to go to school. Early on, he became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying, storing, and selling of grains. He learned about this business from his maternal uncle, who used to be a major grains merchant in his time. 

Concerned about satisfying his clearly growing customer base, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly repaid the fifth loan, he is now on his sixth individual loan, which will be used to purchase 3 tonnes of grains (corn, beans, millet, 'fonio') from peasant producers in and around DIENFING. He will keep the grains for at least three months. He makes his sales to a customer base composed of retailers from big cities, such as Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.

N’TO hopes to make an average monthly profit of 125,000 francs CFA will be used for repaying the loan and reinvesting the rest in business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lanoi

texts.en:
Lanoi is 32 years old, married and blessed with four children that she supports. She has been a mixed-farmer in the area of Nkareta for five years.   She has a monthly income of KES. 50,000, which she uses to support her family.

She has applied for a loan of KES.90,000 from KADET LTD with which she intends to purchase farm inputs and prepare the land for planting.

She intends to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business. Her future dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make breads and pastries for her bake shop.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 49 years old and lives in the town of Kintintale in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children. 

For the past 30 years, Justine has been working hard to manage her banana kiosk, which sells bananas at wholesale. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more banana fruits to be sold, and it will help Justine to generate greater profits and increase her sales and savings. 

Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to start a retail store. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Justine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to purchase more banana fruits to be sold.

loans.name: Isabela

texts.en:
Isabela is a married lady, 43 years old, who supports a family of five people. 

She operates a retail shop and has been running the business for 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000.

She has borrowed this third loan of KES 100,000 from KADET Ltd., with which she intends to expand and restock her retail shop with a variety of goods such as tea leaves, crates of bread, bales of wheat flour, bar soap and bales of maize flour for sale. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children. Her dreams is to improve her living standards and own a residential plot.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves, crates of bread, bales of wheat flour, bar soap and bales of maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a 43-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as honest, trustworthy and obedient. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. Her business goal is to expand her grocery store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standard of her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Aphia

texts.en: Aphia is a 33-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 12 years she has been operating a retail shop. She also raises cattle for additional income. She started the business in order to better her life and her children's lives. Like most retail shop owners she faces a challenges of price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. Her dreams are educating her children up to the university level and owning a wholesale shop. Aphia is requesting a loan to purchase biscuits and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
This is Alice, 42, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Arlendo, a vendor, and is the mother to her children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Alice operates a buy and sell business. She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells it with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alice hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise like undergarments, socks, jeans, dresses and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Yelen Group

texts.fr:
Yelen est un regroupement de 6 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment et de la restauration à l’image de Fanta qui est la personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou (Région de Koulikoro). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a un an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
Fanta qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à Ouelessebougou, excelle dans la restauration. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires, oignon, choux, viande et des céréales.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à Ouelessebougou, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Yelen is a group of six women who have come together by virtue of family and neighbourhood ties. They have an average age of forty, and on average four children each. They undertake various activities, such as the purchase and sale of condiments, and providing meals - like Fanta who is the person seated on the right of the photo.
They live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou (the Koulikoro region). They have been trading for several years and are highly sought after in their respective businesses. 
With the objective of meeting the growing needs of their customers, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit group one year ago. They are on their second collective loan. Fanta, who is the group leader and very well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in the restaurant business. She plans to use her loan to purchase condiments, onions, cabbages, meat and cereals. She buys her produce in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and sells her food products in Ouelessebougou, retail - for cash and credit, to a customer base of both men and women. 
She hopes to obtain a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA - enough to allow her to repay the loan and to invest further in her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for a restaurant.

loans.name: Marilu Rocio

texts.es:
Marilu tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene cuatro hijos, vive  con los hijos y la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.
Marilu  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.
El sueño e s poder comprar una cocina nueva y un microondas. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a jugar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Marilu is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children.  She lives with her husband and children in the city of Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

The El Guasmo community is located in the Agua Fria district of Mocache.  It’s part of the Mocache settlement where they farm and raise livestock.
 
Marilu farms and raises corn.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy insecticides, urea, and herbicides.  This loan will help her to buy what she needs for her crops.  She will make her purchases in Mocache.

Her dream is to buy a new stove and microwave.  She likes to go out and play with her children in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Makhsudjon

texts.ru: Махсудчон проживает в Спитаменском районе. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Махсудчон вместе с женой и родителями занимается скотоводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. В основном Махсудчон разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается более десяти лет. Махсудчон берет кредит для закупа бычков и теленка.
texts.en: Makhsudjon lives in the Spitamen district.  He's thirty-three, and married with three children.  He and his wife and children breed and raise livestock at home for later sale.  He's been in the business for more than ten years and is seeking a loan to buy young bulls and calves.

loans.use: to buy young bulls and calves.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un groupe de l’association Kototala de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans. Mariées avec au moins quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires et de céréales à l’image de SETOU qui est la première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
SETOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à Ouelessebougou, excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 4 sacs de riz et 2 maïs Elle s’approvisionne à Ouelessebougou et villages environnants et vend ses marchandises à Ouelessebougou, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group from the association Kototala de Ouelessebougou. It comprises four women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. Their average age is 42. They are married, have at least four children, and operate different businesses, such as buying and selling condiments and grains, as does SETOU, who is the first person sitting at the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou, in the prefecture of Kati (Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand in their businesses. 

Concerned about meeting the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. They are now on their fourth solidarity loan.

SETOU, who is the group's president and well-known in Ouelessebougou, excels in selling grains. She intends to use her loan to purchase 4 sacks of rice and 2 of corn. She gets her supplies in and around Ouelessebougou. Accepting cash or credit, she sells her grains retail in Ouelessebougou to a customer base composed of men and women.

She is hoping for a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA, which will enable her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
FAIDA est un groupe de l’association BENKAN de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et de céréales à l’image de MALADON qui est la personne arrêtée de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a un an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
MALADON, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  3 sacs de mil, 2 sacs de maïs et 1 sac d’arachide   Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et environnant  et vend ses céréales à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
FAIDA is a group from the association BENKAN de OUELESSEBOUGOU. It comprises four women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. Their average age is 25. They are married, have three children on average, and operate different businesses, such as buying and selling condiments and grains, as does MALADON, who is standing at the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in OUELESSEBOUGOU, in the prefecture of Kati (Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand in their businesses. 

Concerned about meeting the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso a year ago. They are now on their second solidarity loan.

MALADON, who is the group's president and well-known in OUELESSEBOUGOU, excels in selling grains. She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 sacks of millet, 2 sacks of corn, and a sack of peanuts. She gets her supplies in and around OUELESSEBOUGOU. Accepting cash or credit, she sells her grains retail in OUELESSEBOUGOU to a customer base composed of men and women.

She is hoping for a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which will enable her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Alfonsus

texts.en:
Alfonsus is a 39-year-old man who is married to Dessy, 37. They are blessed with three children named Lala, 14; Aprilian, 12, and Triana, 9. All of them are attending school.
 
A couple years ago, Alfonsus ran a kiosk and machine repair businesses. The lack of capital led Alfonsus to quit the business. Now, he is thinking to re-initiate the kiosk business as he needs more income to cover his children’s educational expenses. To do so, Alfonsus requested a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. The capital assistance would enable him to purchase products such as coffee, sugar, instant noodles, eggs and snacks to sell from the kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase products such as coffee, sugar, instant noodles, eggs and snacks.

loans.name: Truphosa

texts.en:
Truphosa is a 53-year-old lady who has been in dairy farming for last 16 years in Kiambu. She is blessed with four children who are all adults. Her monthly income is 60,000 Kenya shillings.

This will be Truphosa's fifth loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow. Because she does farming on her own piece of land, there is great potential to expand her business with the extra profit she receives.

In future she wants continue farming.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with one child. She describes herself as a social woman. 

She operates a retail store where she sells spare parts. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a busy area and her primary customers are motor vehicle owners. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy spare parts. Her business goal is to start a new business of running a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previously, she took a loan of KES 20,000, which she managed to repay successfully.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites, 31, a resident of Cabrera, Philippines. She is single and she lives with her parents and helps them in managing their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Marites operates a buy and sell business. She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells it with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy long sleeve shirts, polo shirts, slacks, towels, skirts and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marites hopes to help her parents and dreams to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of clothing and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Italo Francisco

texts.es:
Ítalo Francisco tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil Casado tiene cinco hijos, vive  con los hijos y la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.

Francisco  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.

El sueño e s poder comprar terrenos. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con los hijos y la esposa conversando.
texts.en:
Ítalo Francisco is forty years old.  He is in a civil union marriage and has five children.  He lives with his children and wife in the city of Ventanas, in the los Ríos province.

The communal bank El Guasmo is located in the area known as "Cold Water of Mocache", which is part of the Mocache region.  People here make a living in agriculture and in livestock.

Francisco makes a living in farming and in growing corn.  He is asking for a loan in order to buy insecticide, urea, and herbicide.  With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what is necessary for his crops.  He will buy the items in the Mocache area.

His dream is to be able to buy his own land.  In his free time, he likes to hang out and converse with his children and wife.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, and herbicide.

loans.name: Hector Aron

texts.es:
Héctor Aron tiene 18 años de edad de estado civil Soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.
Hector se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.
El sueño e s poder comprar un vehículo  para el trabajo. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a comer con la familia afuera.
texts.en:
Héctor Aron, age 18, is single and does not have children.  He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

The Guasmo communal bank is located in the Agua Fría de Mocache precinct in the Mocache canton.  They devote themselves to farming and livestock.

Hector grows corn.  He is requesting the loan to buy insecticides, urea, and herbicides.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops.  He will make his purchases in Mocache.

His dream is to be able to buy a vehicle for work.  In his free time he likes to go out to eat with his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, urea, and herbicides.

loans.name: Jose Absalon

texts.es:
José Absalon tiene 31 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre  tiene dos hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.
José  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.
El sueño e s poder tener un poco mas de ganancia para poder irse de viaje a la playa. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de viaje con la familia.
texts.en:
José Absalon, 31, is in a common-law relationship and has two children.  He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  El Guasmo Communal Bank is located in the Agua Fría de Mocache area of Mocache Canton, where the people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

José makes a living in agriculture growing corn.  He's requesting the loan to buy insecticide, urea, and herbicide.  With the help of the loan he'll be able to buy what he needs for the crops.  He'll make his purchases in the Mocache area.

His dream is to have a little more profit to be able to take a trip to the beach.  In his free time he likes to take trips with his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, and herbicide

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Née vers 1980 à Bamako, Awa vit avec ses 2 enfants et son époux dans une  famille monogame dans le quartier N’tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
Enseignante de profession, très vite Awa s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente d’encens et de savons. 
Après avoir correctement remboursé le prêt précédent, Awa est à son deuxième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité  importante  d’encens et 10 cartons de savon auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché Ouelessebougou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Awa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 at Bamako, Awa lives with her two children and her husband in a monogamous family in the N'tentou area of the city of Ouelessebougou. A teacher by profession, Awa quickly became interested in income generating projects such as the buying and selling of incense and soaps. Having fully repaid the previous loan, Awa is on her second loan with Soro Yiriwaso - which will be used to buy a large quantity of incense and ten boxes of soap from wholesalers.
She makes her sales for cash and credit, on a retail basis door to door and in Ouelessebougou market - to both male and female customers. Awa hopes to generate a monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, which she will use to help her husband meet the family's expenses, to repay the loan, and to invest further in her activities.

loans.use: to purchase soap and incense

loans.name: Galo Ufredo

texts.es:
Galo Ufredo tiene 45 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre  tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.
Galo  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.
El sueño es comprar terrenos para ser un agricultor independiente. En el tiempo libre le gusta incentivar a los hijos y a los jóvenes el deporte.
texts.en:
Galo Ulfredo, age 45, is in a common-law marriage and has four children.  He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

The Guasmo communal bank is located in the Agua Fría de Mocache precinct in the Mocache canton.  They devote themselves to farming and livestock.

Hector grows corn.  He is requesting the loan to buy insecticides, urea, and herbicides.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops.  He will make his purchases in Mocache.

His dream is to be able to buy land in order to be an independent farmer.  In his free time he lives to motivate his children and young people to play sports.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, urea, and herbicides.

loans.name: Santos Esteban

texts.es:
Santos Esteban tiene 44 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre  tiene dos hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.

Santos  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.

El sueño es comprar terrenos. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Santos Esteban is forty-four years old and is in a common-law marriage.  He has two children.  He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas, in the los Ríos province.

The communal bank El Guasmo is located in an area known as "Cold Water of Mocache", which is part of the Mocache region.  People here make a living in agriculture and in livestock.

Santos makes a living in farming and in crowing corn.  He is asking for a loan to buy insecticide, urea, and herbicide.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy what is necessary for his crops.  He will buy these items in the Mocache area.

His dream is to buy land.  In his free time he likes to hang out with his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, and herbicide.

loans.name: Olinda De Jesus

texts.es:
Olinda de Jesús de estado civil Soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.
Olinda  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.
El sueño es comprar terrenos. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Olinda de Jesús is single and does not have children.  She lives with her parents in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

The Guasmo communal bank is located in the Agua Fría de Mocache precinct in the Mocache canon.  They devote themselves to farming and livestock.

Olinda grows corn.  She is requesting the loan to buy insecticides, urea, and herbicides.  With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs for her crops.  She will make her purchases in Mocache.

Her dream is to buy land.  In her free time she likes to go out to take walks.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, urea, and herbicides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more quantities of potatoes, beans and maize to resell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 31 years old and lives in the town of Najera in Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. Mary has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells milk and bread. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase stock in the business with items such as packed juice, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and have a better source of income. Mary hopes that in the future, she will be able to open a wholesale shop. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase stock in the business with items such as packed juice, ugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, 26, is a married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. A hardworking man, he is involved in a number of businesses, such as selling clothes, coffee and maize. His major challenge is the seasonal nature of his businesses and inadequate capital to meet the demands when the season is at peak. However, challenges notwithstanding, he desires to educate his children up to university and own a modern boutique. John intends to use the loan to buy clothes ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ramla

texts.en: Ramla, 47, is a hardworking, unassuming, humble and above all very responsible person. She lives with her family in Msambweni. She sells fresh water from her home. This business helps her family meet household expenses and helps her pay for her children's schooling. At the moment, Ramla is the only one who is supplying water in the neighborhood. She is now requesting a loan to buy a water pump. This investment will allow Ramla to acquire more customers and thus a higher income. Her dream is to expand her business and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more eggs to resell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John sells take away boxes. He has done this for some years now. He is married with 4 children. He uses his income to feed and clothe his children.  John will use his loan to get more take away boxes to sell. With the new profit, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to get more take away boxes to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 28-year-old, married man. He describes himself as focused. He operates a farm from which he sells cabbages, kale and spinach. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a fast growing area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds to improve the business. He will use the loan of KES20,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds. His business goal is to be a successful vegetable distributor within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Raquel Viviana

texts.es:
Raquel Viviana tiene 23 años de estado civil Soltera tiene un hijo, vive con los padres y con el hijo  en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.
Raquel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.
El sueño es comprar terrenos. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Raquel Viviana, 23, is single and has one child.  She lives with her parents and her son in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  El Guasmo Communal Bank is located in the Agua Fría de Mocache area of Mocache Canton, where the people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Raquel makes a living in agriculture growing corn.  She's requesting the loan to buy insecticide, urea, and herbicide.  With the help of the loan she'll be able to buy what she needs for her crops.  She'll make her purchases in the Mocache area.

Her dream is to buy plots of land.  She likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, urea, and herbicide

loans.name: Nicolasa Genoveva

texts.es:
Nicolasa tiene 42 años de estado civil Casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo  en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.
Nicolasa  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.
El sueño es comprar una refrigeradora nueva. En el tiempo libre le gusta atender al hijo y al esposo sobre todo en la comida.
texts.en:
Nicolasa, 42, is married and has a son. She lives with her husband and son in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos province. The communal bank EL GUASMO is in Agua Fría de Mocache, Mocache canton. Its members farm and raise livestock.

Nicolasa is a farmer and plants corn. She is applying for a loan to buy pesticide, urea, and weed killer. With the loan she will be able to buy supplies in Mocache for planting. She dreams of buying a new refrigerator. In her free time, she takes care of her son and husband and does all the cooking.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, urea, and weed killer.

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1970 à Ouelessebougou, Korotoumou vit avec ses 4 enfants et son époux dans une  famille polygame  dans la commune de  Ouelessebougou. 
Korotoumou n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa  grande sœur qui faisait le commerce d’articles divers. Korotoumou, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour  les mêmes activités à savoir le commerce d’articles divers : produits de beauté, produits alimentaires, des parures, etc.
