Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, Korotoumou est à son deuxième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  20 sacs de attièkè, 3 cartons de broches à dents et pour les cheveux,  3 cartons de pâtes dentifrices et 2 cartons de bleu (pour les habits). Elle s’approvisionne avec les  grossistes de Bamako  et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle mixte. 
Korotoumou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in around 1970 in Ouelessebougou, Korotoumou lives with her four children and her husband in a polygamous family in the district of Ouelessebougou. Korotoumou did not have the opportunity to go to school, and she quickly got involved in income generating activities along with her elder sister - a general trader. Following several years experience with her sister, Korotoumou chose the same business, that is general trading in articles such as beauty products, food products, head jewelry etc. Having fully repaid the first loan, she is on her second loan with Soro Yiriwaso - which will be used to purchase twenty bags of attiéké (sort of couscous made from sweet potatoes), three boxes of hairbrushes, three boxes of toothpaste and two boxes of clothing dye.
She buys from wholesalers in Bamako, and makes her sales for both cash and credit, on a retail basis door to door, in the market in Ouelessebougou, and in surrounding fairs - to both male and female customers. 
Korotoumou hopes to generate a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA which she will use to help her husband with the family's expenses, to repay the loan, and to invest further in her activities.

loans.use: to purchase various products for resale.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
LOLO est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de FANIKODJALAN. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30ans. Mariées avec au moins  4 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires et de céréales à l’image de KATRINE qui est la personne arrêtée de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à FANIKODJALAN (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
KATRINE, qui est la présidente du groupe excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de mil de maïs et 1 sac d’arachide.  Elle s’approvisionne à FANIKODJALAN et environnants  et vend ses céréales à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
LOLO is a group from the association BENKADI de FANIKODJALAN. It comprises four women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. Their average age is 30. They are married, have at least four children, and operate different businesses, such as buying and selling condiments and grains, as does KATRINE, who is the person standing at the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in FANIKODJALAN (Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand in their businesses. 

Concerned about meeting the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. They are on their first solidarity loan.

KATRINE, who is the group's president, excels in selling grains. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 sacks of millet or corn and a sack of peanuts. She gets her supplies in and around FANIKODJALAN. Accepting cash or credit, she sells her grains retail in OUELESSEBOUGOU to a customer base composed of men and women.

She is hoping for a monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA, which will enable her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Ergashboy

texts.ru: Эргашбой проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Жена Эргашбоя работает в дехканском хозяйстве, она занимается растениеводством. Эргашбой занимается животноводством. Он вместе с сыном у себя дома разводит крупнорогатый скот. Он в основном закупает скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом бизнеса Эргашбой занимается уже пятнадцать лет. Он берет кредит для закупа коровы, быка и бычков.
texts.en: Ergashboy lives in the city of Khujand. He is forty-four, married, and has three children.  His wife works as a horticulturist on a dehkan [midsized peasant farm].  He earns his living breeding livestock, and he and his son raise cattle at home.  He buy cows, mainly to sell, and has been in business for fifteen years.  He is seeking a loan to buy cows, bulls, and bull-calves.

loans.use: to buy cows, bulls, and bull-calves.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Jackeline Del Rocio

texts.es:
JACKELINE DEL ROCIO tiene 33 años de estado civil Casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos  en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.
JACKELINE DEL ROCIO  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.
El sueño es comprar un terreno. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Jackeline Del Rocio is 33 years old, and is married with two children. She lives with her husband and their children in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos province.
The communal bank El Guasmo is located in the rural community of Agua Fria de Mocache, part of the Mocache canton. The members make a living from agricultural work.
Jackeline Del Rocio earns a living sowing corn. She is requesting the loan to buy insecticides, urea, and herbicides. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs for growing and harvesting. She will buy what she needs in the community of Mocache. 
Her dream is to buy some land. In her free time she likes to play with her children.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, urea, and herbicides to help her grow corn.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Badegna est un regroupement de 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans. Mariées avec 5 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de Diakoro et de la restauration.
Diakoro qui est la personne arrêtée au milieu. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Fanikodjalan, sous-préfecture de Ouelessebougou (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe décident d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
Diakoro, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à Fanikodjalan, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, chou et aubergine). Elle s’approvisionne à Ouelessebougou auprès des grossistes  et vend  à Fanikodjalan en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Badegna is a group of five women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. Their average age is 42. They are married, have five children, and operate different businesses, such as buying and selling condiments, as does Diakoro, and food catering. Diakoro is the person standing at the middle in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in Fanikodjalan, sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou (Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand in their businesses. 

Concerned about meeting the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first solidarity loan.

Diakoro, who is the group's president and well-known in Fanikodjalan, excels in selling condiments. She intends to use her loan to purchase different kinds of condiments (black pepper, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, and eggplant). She gets her supplies in Ouelessebougou from wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she sells her grains retail in Fanikodjalan to a customer base composed of men and women.

She is hoping for a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which will enable her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 31, a resident of Cabrera, Philippines. Single, she manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses.

Imelda operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sell them with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW (ready-to-wear) products and merchandise items like polo shirts, underwear, shirts and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Imelda hopes to have a good life and dreams to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise like polo shirts, underwear, shirts and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma, age 41, is married and has 11 children. She lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Vilma operates a fishing business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She has been in the business for 11 years and earns 3,000 PHP per month. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair fishing boats. Vilma been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Vilma wants to save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to repair fishing boats

loans.name: C23999 Inezanzige Group

texts.en:
Maurrice is 31 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 8 years. He has a pub and he sells beer in his business, which is well organized. He works from 6 AM until 8 PM every day of the week. He has five years of experience in this work and employs three people to help him. 

Maurrice is the leader of the group, which is called “C23999 INEZANZIGE” in the local language, and he is pictured above in the middle with a paper in his hand. He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a greater quantity of beer like skol, amuster, primus, etc. to resell. With the profits he earns, he plans to save money for his future and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more quantity of beer like primis, amuster, minzingi and so on to resell.

loans.name: Theodosia

texts.en: Theodosia lives together with her husband and 2 children in Abura. Theodosia is a petty trader and sells maize, yams, gari, beans and other items, which she has done for some years now. She uses her income to support the husband in the general up keep of their home. Theodosia will use her loan to purchase bags of maize, yams, gari and beans for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, yams, gari and beans for sale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah sells bales of second-hand clothing to retailers at Abura market. She has done this for 3 years. She is married. She uses her income to support her husband in paying the utility bills. Sarah needs this loan to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes to be able to satisfy the retailers who always depend on her. With the new profit from her expanded business, Sarah wants to be one of the main distributors of second-hand clothes in Cape Coast.

loans.use: purchase more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gina Karina

texts.es:
GINA KARINA tiene 20 años de estado civil Casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con los hijos  en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.
GINA KARINA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.
El sueño es comprar un terreno para dejar al hijo que siga construyendo. En el tiempo libre le gusta conversar con el esposo y salir con el hijo a observar cómo están los cultivos.
texts.en:
Gina Karina, 20, is married and has a son. She lives with her husband and son is the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos province. The communal bank EL GUASMO is in Agua Fría de Mocache in Mocache canton, and its members farm and raise livestock. 

Gina Karina farms and plants corn. She is applying for a loan to buy necessary planting supplies such as pesticide, urea, and weed killer in Mocache.
She dreams of having land to leave to her son. In her free time, she likes to talk with her husband and take her son to see the crops.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, urea, and weed killer.

loans.name: Nema

texts.fr:
Née vers 1961, NEMA vit avec ses 4 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire dans la commune rurale de Ouelessebougou. 
NEMA s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui faisait le commerce d’articles divers. NEMA, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente de céréales : arachide, niébé, mil, fonio, maïs, dah etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les prêts précédents, NEMA est à son cinquième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  100 sacs de mil, auprès des paysans producteurs (à OUELESSEBOUGOU, KELEYA et OUROUN) et quelques rare fois avec les  grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs. 
NEMA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1961, NEMA lives with her four children and husband in a nuclear family in Commune Rurale de Ouelessebougou. NEMA became interested in revenue-generating businesses from her aunt, who used to do commerce in a variety of goods. After years of experience with the latter, NEMA opted for buying and selling grains: peanuts, black-eyed peas, millet, fonio, corn, dah, etc. 

After having correctly repaid the previous loans, NEMA is on her fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase 100 sacks of millet from peasant producers (in OUELESSEBOUGOU, KELEYA, and OUROUN) and rarely from local wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail at her home, at the Ouelessebougou market, and at the surrounding fairs. Her customer base is composed essentially of consumers. 

NEMA hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA will be used to help out her husband in meeting the needs of the family, repaying the loan, and reinvesting in business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es: El Sr. Silverio  tiene 34 años tiene un hijo de la edad de 9 años, el se dedica al servicio de  peluquería desde hace mucho tiempo, esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre,  tiene su salón de peluquería que se encuentran ubicado en una zona estratégica de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es el su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Silverio  utilizara este préstamo para la compra de un maquina cortadora de cabello como también  material de peluquería y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejoramiento de su negocio, El Sr. Silverio  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a  utilizar los beneficios para mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia, su deseo del Sr. Silverio  es tener un  negocio estable tener una peluquería muy equipada.
texts.en: Silverio is 34 years old and has a 9 year old son.  He has been a barber for a long time and learned this trade from his father.  He has a shop locate in a strategic area of La Paz.  This will be his third loan through the institution and he will use the money to buy hair clippers and other barber supplies.  This way he will be able to improve his business.  Silverio has challenges in his business, such as increasing his customer base so that he can improve his family’s quality of life.  His desire is to have a stable business and have a well-equipped barber shop.

loans.use: to buy hair clippers and supplies.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 57-year-old, married man. He has 7 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 21 year. He describes himself to be customer friendly, focused and a God-fearing man. He operates a tailoring shop where he sells dresses and repairs worn out clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy fabric. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Matilde is married and has six children. Matilde is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. To earn a living, Matilde is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. She has been doing this for seven years, and she earns 6,000 PHP every month from this work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair a vehicle used in the business. In 2008, Matilde joined GDMPC. In the future, Matilde hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transportation vehicle

loans.name: Benabe Inocente

texts.es:
BENABE INOCENTE  tiene 20 años de estado civil Soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres y en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.
BENABE INOCENTE se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.
El sueño es comprar un casa para algún día formar una familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a caminar con las amigas y conversar de chicos.
texts.en: Benabe Inocente, 20, is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in the city of  Ventanas in Los Ríos province. The communal bank EL GUASMO is in Agua Fría de Mocache in Mocache canton, and its members farm and raise livestock. Benabe Inocente farms and plants corn. He is applying for a loan to buy necessary planting supplies such as pesticide, urea, and weed killer in Mocache. He dreams of buying a house and starting a family. In his free time, he likes to take a walk and talk to his friends.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, urea, and weed killer.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Uranchimeg is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in a 'ger' in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband Erdenebulgan works as assistant in a local market. Her son Dolgoonbold, age 10, goes to primary school and her daughter Ariunbileg, age 4, goes to kindergarten. 

Mrs. Uranchimeg graduated secondary school in 2000, got married to her husband, and gave birth to her children, staying home until 2004. She started working as saleswoman in 2004 and now she is planning to open her own clothing retail store in a local market. She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase clothing inventory to start up her new business in a local market. She is a hard-working and neat woman.

loans.use: to purchase clothing inventory to start up her new business in a local market

loans.name: Jacinto Alejandro

texts.es:
JACINTO ALEJANDRO  tiene 30 años de estado civil Unión Libre  tiene un hijo, vive con los la familia y en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA V.R.C EL GUASMO, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO AGUA FRIA DE MOCACHE, PERTENE AL CANTON MOCAHCE SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS Y PECUARIOS.
JACINTO ALEJANDRO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.  Las compras las hará en el recinto Mocache.
El sueño es comprar un terreno para hacer la casa y poder sembrar. En el tiempo libre le gusta con el hijo a enseñarle a manejar la bicicleta.
texts.en:
30-year old Jacinto Alejandro lives with his common-law wife and son in the town of Ventanas in Los Ríos province. His Community Bank, El Guasmo, is located in the community of Agua Fria de Mocache in Mocache canton. The members work in agriculture or fishing.

Jacinto Alejandro grows corn. He is seeking a loan to buy insecticide, urea, and herbicide. The money will help him buy all that is needed for his crops. He will make his purchases in Mocache. 

Jacinto's dream is to buy some land on which to build a house and sow his crops. In his free time he enjoys teaching his son how to ride his bike.

loans.use: To buy insecticide, urea, and herbicide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is 29 years old. She is a caring, joyful, responsible, supportive, and determined person. She lives with her family, a husband and four children, in the rural area of Msambweni. Mwanajuma has a stand selling fruits and vegetables.

She has had this business for a year and it has been a great help for her children's schooling and household expenses. Mwanajuma is an enterprising young woman and she dreams of having her own mini-market to increase her income and improve her quality of life. It is because of this that, little by little, she is increasing her products and her sales. Currently, she is requesting a loan from Yehu that she will invest in the purchase of tomatoes, onions, kale, cabbages, bananas, oranges, and other produce.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, kale, cabbages, bananas, oranges, and other produce.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu   is a food vendor. She cooks  "Ga- kenkey" and serves it with okra soup and fish  at Abura.  She is married and has one child.  She helps her partner to educate, feed and clothe their child.  Her loan will be used to purchase maize and fish to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a stall in which she can sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase maize and fish to cook for sale.

loans.name: Ines Amanda

texts.es:
Inés Amanda tiene 52 años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con la hermana y con los hijos en Guaranda Sector Cuatro Esquinas Provincia de Bolívar.

LA VRC Cuatro Esquinas Central está formada por 12 socios que pertenecen al sector cuatro esquinas, los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como son agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio y otros.

Inés se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales como: pollos, cerdos, además se dedica a la crianza de borrego e  Hilar lana de borrego.

Las compras y las Ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el Crédito para la comprar pollos,cerdos, semillas, insecticidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudará a producir un poco más de ingresos. El sueño es un vehículo propio.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En los tiempos libres le gusta pasear y disfrutar de la Navidad.
texts.en:
Inés Amanda is 52 years old, single, and has three children. She lives with her sister and children in Cuatro Esquinas, Guaranda, in Bolívar province. 

The 'Cuatro Esquinas Central' community bank has twelve members who live in Cuatro Esquinas. The members make their living in various areas such as farming, raising livestock, business, etc.

Inés is a farmer and raises animals such as chickens and pigs.  She also raises sheep and spins their wool. Inés buys and sells in Guaranda. She is requesting this loan in order to buy chicken, pigs, seeds and pesticides. The loan will help her to make a little more income. Her dream is to have her own vehicle. She has not faced any kind of problem in her work. In her free time she enjoys going for walks and celebrating Christmas.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Protus

texts.en:
Protus is thirty years old, married, and has three children between one and six years old. Two of them are currently attending school. He is a small scale farmer from Kimilili division in Kitale county, western Kenya. His mixed crop farm, which he has been farming for six years, produces maize, beans, potatoes and milk, which he sells locally. He is a passionate entrepreneur and has also invested in a small drugstore in the same region.

Protus has made a loan request of 62,400 KES (Kenyan Shillings) in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He is positive that this loan will him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from the sale of milk will enable him pay school fees for his children and improve the livelihood of his family. He intends to venture into exotic poultry farming in the near future. 

His biggest challenges in this business are competition and the poor transport system in the area.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Monalyn

texts.en:
This is Monalyn, 25, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Romnick, an installer and father to her children. Together with her husband, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.  

Monalyn operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a family tradition, but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend use cooking gas and food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and food costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 15, 000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.  

Monalyn hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams of giving her children a high-quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients like rice, pork, and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la cálida y ciudad de Ica, Ana es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Ana es una joven que aprendió sobre el trabajo desde muy joven, ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos, por lo que empezó a trabajar para poder apoyarlos, pero a pesar de las dificultades Ana se encuentra estudiando la carrera de medicina veterinaria y también trabaja en su pequeño negocio de alquiler de mototaxi, con lo cual solventa los gastos de sus estudios y apoya a sus padres; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo es amable con sus clientes.

Ana está muy agradecida con el apoyo que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo y también podrá ambientar una parte de su vivienda para iniciar un pequeño consultorio para mascotas, de esta manera ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir esforzándose día a día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una clínica veterinaria y apoyar a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Ana, 20, lives in the city of Ica and wants very much to succeed. Since her parents had few resources, she started working to help them out. Despite this difficulty, Ana is studying veterinary medicine and also runs a mototaxi service that pays for her education and helps support her parents. She believes her business is a success because she is very responsible and treats her clients well.

Ana thanks the Kiva lenders for their support which will let her do vehicle maintenance and air condition part of her house where she will set up a veterinary office. In this way, she will be able to increase her income and keep working hard every day to achieve her great dream: to have a veterinary clinic and support her parents.

loans.use: to do vehicle maintenance and air condition her office.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice  sells crates of eggs at Abura market which she has done for some years now. She is married with five children and so uses her income to help her husband to pay her children’s school fees.  Beatrice will use her loan to buy more crates of eggs to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is married and has two children. She is 28 years old and lives in Camanga, Tukuran. Roselyn cultivates a gardening business for a living and she's been 7 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs. In 2010, Roselyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Roselyn wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is a hairdresser. She owns a beauty salon in Abura. She is married and has two children. Theresa has been a hairdresser for a year. She uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills. Theresa will uses her loan to purchase creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer  for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Raulene

texts.en: Raulene is from Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 39 years old. Raulene is married and has four children. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns about 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, she joined GDMPC. Raulene is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past ten years, Catherine has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, where she raises chickens. 

To help expand her business, Catherine has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy poultry feed for the chickens, and it will help Catherine to generate more profit and pay tuition. Catherine hopes that in the future she will be able to have a large poultry farm. 

Catherine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Catherine, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy feed for her poultry farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more copra (dried coconut meat) to resell.

loans.name: Mulei

texts.en: Mulei is a 44-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 7 and 12. He describes himself to be an honest man. He provides transportation services by operating a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located within a town, and his primary customers are business people and residents from the area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to start a new grocery business

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie, 25 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Militar, Tukuran, and is earning a living from her transport service business. It started almost 5 years ago and she earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

To improve business, she is borrowing the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which she joined in 2011, to obtain rickshaw accessories and tires. Before long, Anna Marie is hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain rickshaw accessories and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice farm

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a thirty-one-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. For two years now he has been  selling clothes and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees and invest in coffee and cotton farming as an additional source of income. Price fluctuation and ever changing customer preferences are his major challenges while his dreams are to expand his business to new areas and own a modern boutique. Moses intends to use the loan to buy clothes ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy  clothes to sell.

loans.name: Madaminjon

texts.ru: Мадаминчон 32 - летний женатый мужчина, проживающий в районе Спитамен. Он является отцом двоих детей. Мать Мадаминчона пенсионерка. Его жена портниха, она предоставляет услугу дома. Мадаминчон более восьми лет занимается животноводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Мадаминчон берет кредит для закупа бычков и коров.
texts.en: Madaminjon is a thirty-two-year-old married man.  He lives in the Spitamen district and is the father of two children.  His mother is retired, and his wife is a seamstress who works from home.  Madaminjon has made his living breeding livestock for more than eight years. He is seeking a loan to buy bulls and cows.

loans.use: to buy bulls and cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Hurihon

texts.ru: Хурихон 64 года, замужем. Хурихон  воспитала 4 детей, старшие трое детей имеют свои семьи.Старший сын занимается животноводством и помогает младшему сыну. Муж  и младший сын активно помогает по хозяйству. Благодаря её упорству и трудолюбию семья добилась многих успехов.  В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, Хурихон занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) 40 лет назад, сегодня хозяйство приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS). На данный момент в хозяйстве Хурихон  имеется 2 бычка, 5 голов овец. В собственности заемщицы имеется 0,91 га земли  где они выращивают картофель и кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Хурихон  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычка. Они планируют откормить бычков в течении 5-6 месяцев и затем продать. В планах у Хурихон построить забор вокруг дома.
texts.en: Hurihon is sixty-four-years-old and married with four children.  The three older children have families of their own.  Her eldest son works in livestock and helps her youngest son.  Her husband and younger son help out actively on the farm.  Thanks to her perseverance and diligence, the family has achieved a lot of success.  As the family's chief breadwinner, Hurihon earns her living growing crops and breeding livestock.  She started out forty years ago with 5,000KGS and today the farm brings in nearly 10,000KGS per month.  At present the farm has two bulls and five heads of sheep, and .91 hectares of land where the family grows potatoes and corn.  To further the business, Hurihon has turned to Bai-Tulum for a loan of 75,000KGS so she can buy three bulls to fatten up for sale in five or six months.  Her plans include building a fence around the house.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bulls.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Magie is a 46-year-old resident of Sto. Niño, Tukuran. She has provided the needs of her 3 children from the little amount of 6,000 PHP she has been earning monthly from her fish vending business for 6 years. This business serves as an aid to the income gained from her husband who does fishing. However, this year she joined GDMPC and she is applying for a loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a single mother of one child. She is 49 years old and resides at San Carlos, Tukuran, Philippines. Elena has grown rice for sale to earn a living for 11 years. Each month, she earns PHP 15,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Recently, Elena joined GDMPC. In the future, Elena wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, 49, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Pedro and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Gloria operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like rice, pork, vegetables, chicken, fish and other ingredients. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gloria hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams of having an abundant life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, vegetables, chicken, fish and other ingredients needed in her business.
